alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 11:57AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Warren, Rock Island, eastern Mercer, southwestern Whiteside, Henry, southwestern Jackson, Cedar, Scott, east central Johnson, southeastern Jones, northeastern Muscatine and Clinton Counties through 100 PM CDT... At 1157 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near West Branch to 6 miles southeast of Wilton to near Matherville to near Lake Warren. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wilton, Matherville, Reynolds and Boden around 1200 PM CDT. Durant, Blue Grass, Sherrard, Taylor Ridge and Cable around 1205 PM CDT. Tipton, Milan and Oak Grove around 1210 PM CDT. Walcott around 1215 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Rock Island, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Coal Valley, New Windsor, Alpha, New Windsor, Warner, Moline, Colona, Woodhull, Riverdale, Donahue, Bettendorf, East Moline, Silvis, Hampton, Long Grove, Olin, Calamus, Cleveland, Lynn Center, Le Claire, Orion, Rapids City, Grand Mound, Andover, Oxford Junction and Osborn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 252 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 24. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Scott
